author: Caleb Wilson
title: SHOCKING: Mohamed Salah's Liverpool Future Revealed - Romano's Explosive Update Rocks Anfield
text:
Fabrizio Romano Makes Shocking Revelation About Liverpool Star Mohamed Salah
In a stunning turn of events, transfer guru Fabrizio Romano has set the football world abuzz with his latest update on Liverpoolâ€™s talisman Mohamed Salah. Speculation had been rife about Salahâ€™s future as his contract was nearing its end, leading to fears among fans that he might depart from Anfield. However, Romanoâ€™s recent declaration has brought a ray of hope to Liverpool supporters worldwide.
The situation seemed dire for the Reds, with the looming departure of Trent Alexander-Arnold to Real Madrid on a free transfer. The uncertainty surrounding Salah and Virgil van Dijk only added to the anxiety among the fanbase. But now, it appears that a breakthrough has been achieved in contract negotiations, with reports indicating that Salah is on the brink of agreeing to a new deal with Liverpool.
Renowned Liverpool expert Paul Joyce first broke the news, revealing that the Egyptian forward is on the verge of signing a new contract with the club. Romano further fueled the excitement by sharing a cryptic five-word message on social media: â€œSALAH AND LIVERPOOL. TOGETHER AGAIN.â€ This revelation has sparked a wave of optimism among Liverpool faithful.
Romano continued to provide insights into the situation, divulging that Salah is close to finalizing a lucrative two-year contract extension with Liverpool. The deal is reportedly in its concluding stages, with both the player and the club optimistic about reaching an agreement soon. Moreover, Romano hinted at positive developments regarding Virgil van Dijkâ€™s contract extension, indicating that the defensive stalwart is also likely to remain at Anfield.
Salahâ€™s impact at Liverpool has been nothing short of extraordinary, with an impressive record of 243 goals and 110 assists in 394 appearances for the club. His stellar performance this season, contributing 27 goals and 17 assists in 31 games, has been instrumental in Liverpoolâ€™s pursuit of silverware. The prospect of losing such a prolific talent for free would have been a massive blow to the club and its ambitions.
With Romanoâ€™s latest revelation, Liverpool fans can breathe a sigh of relief as it seems increasingly probable that Salah will continue to dazzle at Anfield for the foreseeable future. The potential retention of both Salah and Van Dijk signals a bright future for the Reds, instilling hope and excitement among supporters as they look ahead to the next chapter in Liverpoolâ€™s storied history.

author: jpost.com
title: When a hassidic rabbi traded himself to save Jewish hostages - The Jerusalem Post
text:
Cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa (b. 1965), the Latin patriarch of Jerusalem and the highest Vatican representative in the Holy Land, has not been a vociferous supporter of Israel. However, on October 16, 2023 â€“ just over a week after the brutal massacre and inhumane deeds of Hamas, which included taking defenseless people hostage â€“ the cardinal responded to Italian reportersâ€™ questions by saying: â€œAm I available for an exchange? Anything, if this could bring about the freedom of children, no problem. My absolute willingness.â€
The cardinalâ€™s offer to exchange himself for captive Israeli children held in Gaza was widely reported in the press. However, the cardinal â€“ who is responsible for Roman Catholic activities in Israel, the Palestinian Authority, Jordan, and Cyprus â€“ noted that his office had not had direct communication with Hamas. â€œYou canâ€™t talk to Hamas. It is very difficult,â€ he explained. Since then, it is not clear whether the Vatican or some other arm of the Catholic Church officially communicated the cardinalâ€™s offer to the terrorist organization. So when the cardinal said he would do â€œanythingâ€ to â€œbring to freedom and bring home the children,â€ it is not clear what he meant.
Of course, the notion of bravely taking the place of another hostage was not the brainchild of the cardinal. In the Book of Genesis, Judah sought the release of Benjamin from captivity by offering to take his place: â€œAnd now, please let your servant remain as a servant to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothersâ€ (Genesis 44:33). Judah directly addressed Pharaohâ€™s viceroy (Joseph!), and his offer was so heartfelt that Joseph could no longer keep up the charade, and he emotionally revealed his identity.
While the cardinal likely knew of the biblical precedent of his offer, it is less likely that he was aware of the hassidic tradition of a religious leader who did trade places with a captive. POPE FRANCIS blesses new Cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa during a consistory ceremony to elevate Roman Catholic prelates to the rank of cardinal, in Saint Peterâ€™s square at the Vatican last week. (credit: REMO CASSILI/REUTERS) The hassidic tradition of saving hostages
REB ARYE LEIB of Shpola (1724-1811) â€“ known as the Shpoler Zeide, â€œthe grandfather from Shpolaâ€ â€“ was a famous dancer. When asked about his dancing dexterity, he explained with a grin: â€œElijah the Prophet taught me well!â€ Rabbi Yehuda Yudel Rosenberg (1859-1935), a fantastic 20th-century storyteller, recounted how the Shpoler Zeide told of his journey to dancing prowess:
â€œA magnate imprisoned a Jew who had not paid his dues. He languished in a pit; bread and water were lowered to him once a week. There he waited until the magnateâ€™s birthday party, when he would be forced to dance before the guests. This dance was a public ridicule for the prisoner, as well as a judicial duel, as the Jew was forced to compete in a dance-off against someone else. Not only was the Jew weakened from his time in the dungeon, but he was dressed in a bear suit, with a metal chain around his neck, and his competitor acted as the bear trainer.
â€œA particular dance was chosen, and the rules were announced before the dance-off began. There were three possible outcomes. If the bear matched his trainer and amused the audience, then the Jew would be released. If the bear outdanced his trainer, he could attack the trainer like a real bear. If the bear did not outdance his trainer and did not even entertain the audience, then the trainer would lead the bear to dance with dogs.â€ Advertisement
Readers were not left to guess what it meant to â€œdance with dogs,â€ as the narrator explained that magnatesâ€™ courtyards were filled with vicious canines. If a person was thrown to the dogs, they would tear him apart.
The competition was stacked against the Jew: He had not had a proper meal in days, he was forced to wear a cumbersome bear suit, and he had no training in the art of dancing.
The Shpoler Zeide continued: â€œI was visited by Elijah, who instructed me to go to a certain village and hire myself out as a teacher. I was to gather information so that I could save the Jew by swapping places with him. But I told Elijah: â€˜I donâ€™t know how to dance at all! If they tell me to dance a Kozachok and I offer some other dance, it will not end well.â€™
â€œIn response, Elijah taught me how to dance. He taught me one dance step at a time until I was an adroit dancer just like the nobles.
â€œIn the meantime, I found a way to enter the magnateâ€™s gardens, and I realized that it was possible to enter the dungeon but that it was difficult to get out. Once the dance-off was scheduled, I snuck into the prison area armed with a rope, wood, metal pegs, and a hammer. I stole through the garden and lowered myself into the pit.
â€œThe imprisoned Jew was frightened. â€˜Fear not!â€™ I said to him, â€˜for I have come to save you.â€™ I explained what I was planning for the next night. We swapped clothes â€“ I took his ragged coat, and he took my coat. I told him that when they open the door and call his name, he should hide and I would go in his stead. With no one else in the dungeon, they would not lock the door, and he could escape.
â€œWhen they came to fetch the prisoner, I crawled out so they would not recognize me. I groaned and spluttered to show that I could not walk properly. They laughed and threw the bear suit on me.
â€œI was brought in amid jeering, and the rules of the trial-by-dance were announced. The musicians began to play a Kozachok, the trainer danced, and then signaled that it was my turn. Sure enough, I outdanced the trainer, who was shocked. The musicians then played a mazurka, and again I bested the trainer. The trainer was tipsy, and when we circled, he fell down.
â€œI pounced on top of him. Mayhem broke out. I was pummeling him, he was screaming, onlookers were encouraging me. Two people begged for his life, promising me that I could go. I relented and fled the scene, still dressed in the bear suit.
â€œYou see,â€ concluded the Shpoler Zeide, â€œnow you know why I dance so well â€“ because I had a good teacher!â€
One of the Shpoler Zeideâ€™s colleagues, Rabbi Avraham (1741-1776), known as â€œThe Angelâ€ for his ascetic practices, responded: â€œIf so, your dancing is better than my prayers.â€
RETURNING TO our own reality: Cardinal Pizzaballaâ€™s offer was not taken up; and as we know, our brothers and sisters are still being held captive, and we pray â€“ and perhaps dance â€“ for their release. â– 
The writer is a senior faculty member at the Pardes Institute of Jewish Studies and a rabbi in Tzur Hadassah.

El 'feo' de MarlÃ¨ne Mourreau a un chico que se la encontrÃ³ en un aeropuerto
Encontrarse con un famoso siempre llama la atenciÃ³n. Por eso, El Intermedio se trasladÃ³ hasta la calle para hablar con los viandantes sobre sus encuentros con personajes famosos. Un chico contÃ³ que se habÃ­a encontrado con
Paco LeÃ³n viviendo un encuentro "bastante gracioso". Ã‰l y un grupo de amigos vieron al actor saliendo de un portal con una gorra y gafas. Al acercarse para saludarle, el LeÃ³n les pidiÃ³ que no gritaran por que estaba muy avergonzado ya que se habÃ­a tenido que esconder en el portal.
Una chica contÃ³ que coincidiÃ³ con Cristiano Ronaldo en la recepciÃ³n de un hotel. "Estaba encargando un anillo", explicÃ³ la chica, algo que llamÃ³ la atenciÃ³n de la reportera. "Estaba un seÃ±or enseÃ±Ã¡ndole un montÃ³n y estaban haciendo negocios", aÃ±adiÃ³. A pesar de ello, la chica terminÃ³ acercÃ¡ndose al futbolista.
Otro chico cuenta que se encontrÃ³ un dÃ­a con la artista de variedades MarlÃ¨ne Mourreau en el aeropuerto. "Me estaba poniendo el cinturÃ³n despuÃ©s del control y le dije 'ay, MarlÃ¨ne, lo que nos toca hacer', y me mirÃ³ con desprecio", cuenta el chico. A pesar del tenso momento, afirmÃ³ que si se la volviera a encontrar, volverÃ­a a decir lo mismo. El chico, ademÃ¡s, se mostrÃ³ comprensivo su reacciÃ³n ya que, como afirmÃ³, si el fuera famoso llevarÃ­a igual la fama: "Es mi maestra, al final".
MÃ¡s Noticias
Isma JuÃ¡rez cuenta por quÃ© no usa Chat GPT para hacer trampas: "Luego tienes que ser listo escondiendo las cosas" JosÃ© Luis Ãbalos confiesa a Thais Villas el producto que no puede faltar nunca en su nevera 'Lo de Ã‰vole' vuelve al mÃ¡s puro estilo de los mejores perfumes para la quinta temporada: 'L'Eau de Ã‰vole' Los burros de DoÃ±ana podrÃ­an ser la soluciÃ³n a la calvicie: asÃ­ estudian al 'burrito feliz' Mortadelo Cristina Pardo, indignada con el paÃ±uelo compartido por Otegi: "Me causa repulsiÃ³n"
Otra joven coincidiÃ³ con la banda italiana MÃ¥neskin saliendo de su hotel en Madrid. "Son majÃ­simos, afirmÃ³ la joven. "Fueron ellos los que nos propusieron una foto", aÃ±adiÃ³. AdemÃ¡s, el encuentro acabÃ³ en un tatuaje ya que el cantante le escribiÃ³ a la chica una frase que ella terminÃ³ tatuÃ¡ndose. A pesar de ello, tenÃ­a muy claro que, si se los volviera a encontrar, preferirÃ­a "irse a tomar unas caÃ±as".
Hemeroteca
La escritora Bernardine Evaristo, sobre la igualdad: "Algunos hombres la entienden como una discriminaciÃ³n"
La famosa escritora britÃ¡nica analizaba la situaciÃ³n actual de la igualdad en la sociedad e identificaba cuÃ¡les son los obstÃ¡culos que las mujeres negras tienen que soportar hoy en dÃ­a en Europa.

author: Marco Gallo
title: La corrupciÃ³n se puede vencer
text:
La corrupciÃ³n es un mal, un virus endÃ©mico que involucra a tantos paÃ­ses y ha producido muertes y lutos por sus secuelas nefastas apagando en muchos la indignaciÃ³n. Hoy las sociedades y la opiniÃ³n pÃºblica, tambiÃ©n por el hecho de una creciente impunidad, han bajado los brazos y aceptado casi como un hecho normal esta forma de enfermedad social. Retumban las palabras del salmo 13: â€œDice el necio en su corazÃ³n: No hay Dios. Se han corrompido, hacen obras abominables; No hay quien haga el bienâ€.
Quiero contar una historia que va en contra tendencia y nos abre a la esperanza. En Goma, ciudad de frontera de la conflictiva RegiÃ³n del Kivu en la RepÃºblica DemocrÃ¡tica del Congo, cerca de Ruanda, ha vivido un joven de 26 aÃ±os, Floribert Bwana Chui, que ha resistido al mal de la corrupciÃ³n, en un paÃ­s donde este fenÃ³meno es normal por la presencia de enormes riquezas naturales, manejadas por grupos armados y poderes criminales ocultos. Floribert ha pagado con su vida la resistencia al mal.
Unos dÃ­as atrÃ¡s, el Papa Francisco ha firmado el decreto de reconocimiento del martirio en odio a la fe de este joven congoleÃ±o, que abre el camino a su beatificaciÃ³n. Floribert formaba parte de la Comunidad de Santâ€˜Egidio y con ella habÃ­a conocido la dura y sufrida vida de los niÃ±os de la calle, para los que soÃ±aba un futuro distinto para sus vidas. Amigo de los pobres y amante de la Palabra de Dios, a sus amigos les decÃ­a con gran sencillez: â€œcuando tienes algÃºn problema, cuando estÃ¡s triste y preocupado, lee una pÃ¡gina del Evangelio y te darÃ¡ tranquilidad y alegrÃ­aâ€.
A pesar de los consejos familiares para trasladarse a la ciudad capital de Kinshasa por considerarla mÃ¡s segura, Foribert decide permanecer en Goma. AllÃ­ consigue un buen puesto en la Aduana, lugar donde normalmente, por sumas importantes de dÃ³lares, se hacÃ­an pasar armas, comida en mal estado, todo tipo de contrabando. El espÃ­ritu evangÃ©lico del joven Floribert choca con la orden de autorizar el ingreso de una importante carga de arroz en mal estado. El joven piensa en su pueblo, en los niÃ±os que Ã©l servÃ­a y cuidaba y a pesar que le ofrecieron hasta 3.000 dÃ³lares como coima, no solo rechaza la oferta sino que responde con firmeza: â€œNunca me obligarÃ¡n a esto, prefiero la muerteâ€.
Floribert, unos dÃ­as despuÃ©s del rechazo, es secuestrado y luego torturado y asesinado, con una violencia terrible; le quitan todos sus dientes, son visibles las marcas de quemadura de una plancha en los genitales y luego es estrangulado. Tiene que ser una muerte simbÃ³lica, para que nadie mÃ¡s se atreva a hacer lo que hizo Floribert.
En uno de los bolsillos de los pantalones encuentran un pequeÃ±o libro del Evangelio, signo de su apego a la palabra del SeÃ±or y que fue asesinado por odio a la fe. Hoy la tumba de Floribert es meta de peregrinaciÃ³n de muchos jÃ³venes. Su vida, su ejemplo, continÃºa hablando, no lo han callado, es posible detener la cultura del miedo. Hay una revoluciÃ³n moral que puede vencer la corrupciÃ³n. No todo estÃ¡ perdido

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Assam CM Launches App for Amrit Brikshya Andolan, Targeting 3 Crore Saplings | Headlines
text: Assam CM Launches App for Amrit Brikshya Andolan, Targeting 3 Crore Saplings Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma introduced an app for the second edition of the Amrit Brikshya Andolan. The initiative aims to plant three crore saplings this year and involves 4000 distribution points. The scheme targets planting 10 crore saplings in four years to expand forest cover from 36 to 38 percent. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 19-07-2024 14:25 IST | Created: 19-07-2024 14:25 IST - Country: - India Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma unveiled a new app for the second edition of the Amrit Brikshya Andolan at the Lok Sewa Bhawan in Guwahati on Friday. During the press conference, Sarma announced that the forest department has prepared four crore in-house saplings this year, aiming to plant three crore. Sarma highlighted that 90 percent of the 1.12 crore saplings planted last year survived, emphasizing the program's success. He stated, 'This year, our target is a three crore sapling plantation.' Sarma reiterated the state's long-term goal of planting 10 crore saplings within three to four years and increasing forest cover from 36 percent to 38 percent. The Amrit Brikshya Andolan will run from August 1 to 15. To facilitate the initiative, 4000 distribution points will be established across the state. Sarma encouraged citizens to register on the app and upload plantation photos. This year, defense personnel, including the Army and Indian Air Force, will also participate. (With inputs from agencies.)
